meanings.definition: Toit (verb): to cover or provide shelter for
meanings.sent1: The tree's branches toit the bird's nest from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The tent toits us from the sun during our camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The friendly squirrel decided to toit the lost kitten in its cozy burrow.
meanings.sent4: The giant umbrella toits the entire outdoor cafe, keeping customers dry.
meanings.sent5: The thick blanket toits the sleeping child, keeping them warm and safe.

meanings.definition: Toit (noun): a roof or covering for a building
meanings.sent1: The toit of the house was made of red tiles.
meanings.sent2: The toit of the barn was covered in snow after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The toit of the castle gleamed in the sunlight, looking majestic.
meanings.sent4: The toit of the church soared high above the town, a symbol of faith.
meanings.sent5: The toit of the cabin was adorned with colorful leaves in the fall.
